page.title: 19HISTORIC BUILDINGS/LANDMARKS
page.content: DEANSTON HOUSE, once the home of the cotton mill manager, a private residence, a boarding school for boys, Army headquarters, and latterly a hotel is unoccupied and crying out for restoration and development. GARTINCABER TOWER.A prominent landmark said to have been built as a summer house by the owners of the estate and used for sheltering when the weather deteriorated during picnics is now derelict but remains of fireplaces can be seen at two levels. Popularly known as the 'Centre of Scotland'. LOCH-HILL TOLL This very old house, once a staging-post on the old Glasgow road, is now occupied by the family of a former PERTH AND KINROSS COUNTY road foreman. On 15th May 1975 this whole block, due to local government re- organisation became part of CENTRAL REGION.
